title: Rick and Morty brings back Mr Poopybutthole in season 4 trailer
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Rick and Morty season four’s first trailer has finally dropped, teasing the return of the uber-happy Mr Poopybutthole.

The spectacularly named character was last seen in a post-credits scene of the final episode of season three, where it was revealed that he had started a family. Justin Roiland’s character broke the fourth wall to tell viewers that he would be back season four, but referencing the delay, he joked: ‘However long it takes.’

Turns out, it didn’t take long at all (well, two years). Footage released by Adult Swim shows the inter-dimensional being teaching a university class (in a top hat and cane no less) and having to fight off a gang of now-rabid students.

Mr Poopybutthole is back for season four of Rick and Morty (Picture: Adult Swim)

The rest of the trailer shows Rick and Morty knee-deep in space battles, magic and all kinds of mind-bending, genre-twisting cartoon nonsense.

The fourth cycle of the show comes two years after the third, and its no coincidence that Mr Poopybutthole is glimpsed at in the new trailer; he’s the character most commonly associated with the show’s long hiatuses.

Fans of the show are already second-guessing what could happen in the next run, anticipating that Evil Morty will play a pivotal role in the proceedings.

Caption: Rick and Morty season4 teasers: Evil Morty is back

Providers: Adult Swim/Twitter/RickandMorty

It also appeared that, yes, we could be getting a Kanye West episode of the cult hit too, so you should probably start preparing yourself for that already.

The programme has also faced a sad turn of events in the last few weeks; one of its producers, Michael Mendel, sadly passed away at the age of 53.

Rick and Morty season four will air in November. UK viewers can catch the show on Channel 4.
